issue.body:
This issue describes the implementation plan for eslint/rfcs#9, which will take place in several phases:

## Phase 1: Extract current config system

- [x] Create new GitHub repository (`eslint/eslintrc`)
- [x] Copy`eslintrc` source files and tests into new GitHub repository
- [x] Create Jenkins release job for `@eslint/eslintrc`
- [x] Publish `@eslint/eslintrc` to npm
- [x] Update ESLint to use `@eslint/eslintrc`
- [x] Remove in-memory filesystem from tests
- [x] Update `CLIEngine` to use `CascadingConfigArrayFactory` from `@eslint/eslintrc`

## Phase 2: Implement flat config with `eslintrc` compatibility

- [x] Create the `FlatCompat` class in `eslint/eslintrc` repository
- [x] Create `FlatConfigArray` to represent simple configs
- [x] Update `Linter` class to understand `FlatConfigArray` objects
- [x] Ensure `Linter#defineRule` and `Linter#definePlugin` throw errors when using `FlatConfigArray`
- [x] Add `context.languageOptions` in backwards-compatible way to `context` in `Linter`
- [x] Ensure `context.parserPath` still works in `Linter` for `FlatConfigArray` (for now)
- [x] Create `FlatRuleTester` to allow rule testing with `FlatConfigArray` format
- [x] Create `FlatESLint` class to mirror `ESLint` class but use `eslint.config.js` instead
- [x] #15661
- [x] #15683
- [x] #15687
- [x] Implement caching
- [x] Update `cli.js` to search for `eslint.config.js` file and use `FlatESLint` if found (`ESLint` if not)
- [x] Ensure invalid CLI flags cause errors when using flat config (for example, `--resolve-plugins-relative-to`)
- [x] Switch `eslint/eslint` repo to use flat config
- [x] Document flat config
- [x] Release ESLint with `eslintrc` compatibility
- [x] #16416
- [x] #16415
- [x] #16414 
- [x] #16413 
- [x] #16410 
- [x] #16402 
- [x] #16341 
- [x] #16340 
- [x] #16299 
- [x] #16275 
- [x] #16265 
- [x] #16264
- [x] #16537
- [x] #16875

## Phase 3: Compatibility testing

- [ ] Work with `typescript-eslint` to switch to new format and ensure it works correctly ([pull request](https://github.com/typescript-eslint/typescript-eslint/pull/6836))
- [ ] Work with `eslint-plugin-import` to switch to new format and ensure it works correctly (@mdjermanovic) https://github.com/import-js/eslint-plugin-import/pull/2829 https://github.com/import-js/eslint-plugin-import/pull/2873
- [ ] Work with `eslint-config-airbnb` to switch to new format and ensure it works correctly (@mdjermanovic)
- [x] Work with `eslint-config-standard` to switch to new format and ensure it works correctly ([pull request](https://github.com/standard/eslint-config-standard/pull/277)]
- [x] Work with `eslint-plugin-n` to switch configs to new format and ensure it works correctly (@mdjermanovic) ([pull request](https://github.com/eslint-community/eslint-plugin-n/pull/95))
- [ ] Work with `eslint-plugin-vue` to switch configs to new format and ensure it works correctly ([pull request](https://github.com/vuejs/eslint-plugin-vue/pull/2226))
- [ ] Work with `eslint-plugin-react` to switch configs to new format and ensure it works correctly (@mdjermanovic) ([pull request](https://github.com/jsx-eslint/eslint-plugin-react/pull/3600))
- [x] Switch ESLint config to load external configs/plugins without `FlatCompat`
- [x] Release ESLint with extended compatibility

## Phase 4: General availability (v9.0.0)

- [x] Write blog post about flat config format
- [x] Output warning when people use `eslintrc` files
- [x] Switch documentation so `eslint.config.js` is the default and recommended format (link to legacy `eslintrc` docs from the same page)
- [x] Switch `Linter` to use flat config by default
- [x] Switch documentation for shareable configs to flat config format (links to legacy docs included)
- [x] Switch documentation for plugins to flat config format (links to legacy docs included)
- [x] #14308
- [x] Rename `ESLint` class to `LegacyESLint` and rename `FlatESLint` to `ESLint`
- [x] Delete `RuleTester` class and rename `FlatRuleTester` to `RuleTester`
- [x] Update `api.js` to export new values for `ESLint` and `RuleTester`
- [x] Switch `shouldUseFlatConfig()` to return `true` except if `ESLINT_USE_FLAT_CONFIG` is `false`.
- [x] Release ESLint with GA flat config

## Phase 5: Remove `eslintrc` (v10.0.0)

- [ ] Remove old CLI flags
- [ ] Remove `context.parserPath`, `context.parserOptions`, `context.globals` in `Linter` (#20086, eslint/rewrite#263)
- [ ] Remove `configType` constructor option for `Linter`; throw error if found.
- [ ] Report an error when `eslint-env` config comment is used (#20128)
- [ ] Remove `eslintrc` support (#20037)
- [ ] Remove `eslintrc` documentation
- [ ] Delete `FlatESLint` class
- [ ] Delete `LegacyESLint` class
- [ ] Switch `shouldUseFlatConfig()` to always return `true` 
- [ ] Release ESLint without `eslintrc` :tada:

body:
Given all pros and cons, I think the best option is 2.

> * Introducing function configs complicates sharing configs. Whereas right now we can assume that a shared config is either an object (you can use with the spread operator) or an array of objects (you can use `map()` to apply to different `files` and `ignores`), function configs hide their internals, and because they expect that `context` object, will be hard to manipulate and customize.

Assuming that a shared config will document what it exports (an object, array, or function), if it's a function, config file that uses the shared config can call it with the `context` object and then customize the return value the same as it would customize an exported object/array?

> Assuming that a shared config will document what it exports (an object, array, or function), if it's a function, config file that uses the shared config can call it with the context object and then customize the return value the same as it would customize an exported object/array?

Ideally, yes they should document this. However, this will increase the learning curve for both users and plugin authors and could be problematic for users depending upon older versions of plugins who haven't updated their docs yet.

I'm wondering if we could take option 4:  exporting the configs in the ESLint package itself, e.g. `require("eslint").configs.recommended`.

pros: same as option 1.

it was mentioned in the rfc, the reasons for not being adopted is ["the config needs to specify a particular version of ESLint as its dependency".](https://github.com/eslint/rfcs/tree/main/designs/2019-config-simplification#why-are-eslintrecommended-and-eslintall-strings-instead-of-objects). but imo, it seems not a very big deal - the shared configs can specify eslint as peer deps, and give a range instead of an exact version, e.g. `"eslint": "~8.0.0"`

**TSC Summary:** The one capability flat config doesn't currently have that eslintrc does is the ability to implement `extends: "eslint:recommended"`. This is the last compatibility piece for flat config to address before we move on to the next phase. This issue presents three options for how to move forward.

**TSC Question:** How do we want to support this use case in flat config?

In the 2022-12-29 TSC meeting, we decided to publish the `recommended` and `all` configs in a new package named `@eslint/js`. Initially, this package will live in the `eslint` repository. Eventually, it will contain all JS-specific logic.

<!--
    Thank you for contributing!

    ESLint adheres to the [JS Foundation Code of Conduct](https://eslint.org/conduct).
-->

#### Prerequisites checklist

- [x] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/eslint/eslint/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md).

#### What is the purpose of this pull request? (put an "X" next to an item)

<!--
    The following template is intentionally not a markdown checkbox list for the reasons
    explained in https://github.com/eslint/eslint/pull/12848#issuecomment-580302888
-->

[ ] Documentation update
[ ] Bug fix ([template](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eslint/eslint/HEAD/templates/bug-report.md))
[ ] New rule ([template](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eslint/eslint/HEAD/templates/rule-proposal.md))
[ ] Changes an existing rule ([template](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eslint/eslint/HEAD/templates/rule-change-proposal.md))
[ ] Add autofix to a rule
[ ] Add a CLI option
[x] Add something to the core
[ ] Other, please explain:

<!--
    If the item you've checked above has a template, please paste the template questions below and answer them. (If this pull request is addressing an issue, you can just paste a link to the issue here instead.)
-->

<!--
    Please ensure your pull request is ready:

    - Read the pull request guide (https://eslint.org/docs/latest/contribute/pull-requests)
    - Include tests for this change
    - Update documentation for this change (if appropriate)
-->

<!--
    The following is required for all pull requests:
-->

#### What changes did you make? (Give an overview)

Relocates the "eslint:all" and "eslint:recommended" configs into the `@eslint/js` package so they can be referenced from there instead of as strings. I needed to change the "eslint:all" file to be autogenerated at build time rather than from run time because it won't be able to reference the full rule list at run time. (The rules are outside of the package.)

In order to do this, I had to do an initial publish of `@eslint/js`. I also added a Jenkins job to make releasing this package easy.

Additionally, whenever a file in the `lib/rules` directory is `lint-staged` will regenerate `eslint-all.js` so that we are automatically updating that configuration. We will still have to manually release `@eslint/js` in the short term if there are any changes.

Fixes #16537

#### Is there anything you'd like reviewers to focus on?

I added a deprecation notice for using `"eslint:recommended"` and `"eslint:all"` as strings inside of flat config to let people know they should switch to `@eslint/js`. Because people are starting to use flat config, I don't think we want to break this usage. Currently, this results in deprecation notices even when using `FlatCompat` because we just [pass through the strings](https://github.com/eslint/eslintrc/blob/f7d0f33b30b3839800df046df1f5139941cdbd1a/lib/flat-compat.js#L57-L65).

Does it make sense to update `@eslint/eslintrc` to use `@eslint/js` directly as well? Or, should we force people to pass in their own reference to `@eslint/js` in the `FlatCompat` constructor?

<!-- markdownlint-disable-file MD004 -->

body: "eslint:recommended" is a special string (for now) that ESLint itself interprets. You can't do "plugin:other-plugin/recommended" because flat config does not dynamically load plugins for you like eslintrc does. That's why you need to pass a reference rather than a string.

issue.title: The `files` setting with base configs

repository.name: eslintrc
repository.description: The legacy ESLintRC config file format for ESLint

issue.body:
From https://github.com/eslint/eslint/issues/8813

The `extends` setting in the `overrides` section was a long-standing issue and it's a popular feature now.

Currently, the flat config doesn't provide an easy way for that.
I think a solution is the following one:

```js
import baseConfig from "my-eslint-config"
import mocha from "eslint-plugin-mocha"
export default [
  baseConfig.base,
  {
    "files": ["/scripts/**", "/server/**"],
    "configs": [baseConfig.node], // may have different settings for CJS and ESM. Also, it mey be a function to check `${cwd}/package.json`'s module type.
  },
  {
    "files": ["/client/**/*"],
    "configs": [baseConfig.browser],
  },
  {
    "files": ["/test/**/*.js"],
    "configs": [baseConfig.node, mocha.configs.recommended],
  },
]
```

It just merges the `files` properties in the flattening phase by [AND patterns](https://github.com/eslint/rfcs/tree/master/designs/2019-config-simplification#using-and-patterns-for-files).
